item.title: Report X-2025020443
item.description:
Report X-2025020443

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DMP PROCESSING AREA IN SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER SAW WAS A PACKAGE WITH CORROSIVE 8 AND OXIDIZER 5.1 LABELS. READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR BOTH. ADDED SILVER SHIELD LINERS TO INSIDE OF GLOVES. SOLIDIFIED LIQUIDS WITH ZEP ZORBENT AND THEN TESTED WITH PH TAPE. WAS NOT WITHIN 6-9 RANGE SO ADDED SODIUM BICARBONATE TILL MIXTURE WAS NOT AN ALKALINE OR BASE. READ WASTE DISPOSAL CHART AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. AFTER PROCESSING, REFERRED TO DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST.

item.title: Report X-2025020420
item.description:
Report X-2025020420

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-01
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2025020420 RESPONDER REPORTED TO DR 48 IN THE UNLOAD. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR. BOX WAS WET ON THE SIDE. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING X-2025020419 RESPONDER REPORTED TO DR 48 IN THE UNLOAD. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR. BOX WAS WET ON THE SIDE. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. item.title: Report E-2025020125
item.description:
Report E-2025020125

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 8:41 AM ET, BCA contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Carlisle, PA. The spill consists of approximately 2 cups of 1360 Urethane Reducer Fast, which released from 1â€“4-gallon plastic jug due to a forklift blade puncturing the container while it was inside of a cardboard box, dampening the box. No surfaces were affected by the spill. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will place the box and the jug into a 20-gallon poly drum.

item.description:
Report X-2025020077

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-31
  • City: Carlisle
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Todd Rayno, 042 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN1824 sodium hydroxide solution spill inside the trailer. Todd Rayno stated it appears to have been punctured by the previous terminal. Safety reviewed manifest movement, and the freight arrived at 042 from 106. Todd Rayno advised the spill has dried up on the skid.

  • Description: At 04:58 EST on 1/9, XPO-BCA contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 cup of Isobutanol from a 55-gal metal drum onto the trailer floor. The drum was punctured during loading at XBP. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE.
